item.text: King Nebuchadnezzar had a golden statue made. It was 90 feet tall and 9 feet wide. He erected it on the plain of Dura in the province of Babylon.

Then <st data-num="04430" class="">King</st> <st data-num="05020" class="">Nebuchadnezzar</st> <st data-num="07972" class="">sent out a summons</st> to <st data-num="03673" class="">assemble</st> the <st data-num="0324" class="">satraps</st>, <st data-num="05460" class="">prefects</st>, <st data-num="06347" class="">governors</st>, <st data-num="0148" class="">counselors</st>, <st data-num="01411" class="">treasurers</st>, <st data-num="01884" class="">judges</st>, <st data-num="08614" class="">magistrates</st>,<n id="1" /> and <st data-num="03606" class="">all</st> the other <st data-num="07984" class="">authorities</st> of the <st data-num="04083" class="">province</st> to <st data-num="0858" class="">attend</st> the <st data-num="02597" class="">dedication</st> of the <st data-num="06755" class="">statue</st> <st data-num="01768" class="">that</st> <st data-num="05020 04430">he</st><n id="2" /> had <st data-num="06966" class="">erected</st>.

So the satraps, prefects, governors, counselors, treasurers, judges, magistrates, and all the other provincial authorities assembled for the dedication of the statue that King Nebuchadnezzar had erected. They were standing in front of the statue that Nebuchadnezzar had erected.
Then the herald made a loud proclamation: “To you, O peoples, nations, and language groups, the following command is given:
When you hear the sound of the horn, flute, zither, trigon, harp, pipes, and all kinds of music, you must bow down and pay homage to the golden statue that King Nebuchadnezzar has erected.

<st data-num="04479 01768">Whoever</st> does <st data-num="03809" class="">not</st> <st data-num="05308" class="">bow down</st> and <st data-num="05457" class="">pay homage</st> will <st data-num="08160" class="">immediately</st><n id="1" /> be <st data-num="07412" class="">thrown</st> into the <st data-num="01459" class="">midst</st> of a <st data-num="0861" class="">furnace</st> of <st data-num="03345" class="">blazing</st> <st data-num="05135" class="">fire</st>!”

Therefore when they all heard the sound of the horn, flute, zither, trigon, harp, pipes, and all kinds of music, all the peoples, nations, and language groups began bowing down and paying homage to the golden statue that King Nebuchadnezzar had erected.
Now at that time certain Chaldeans came forward and brought malicious accusations against the Jews.

They <st data-num="06032 0560">said</st><n id="1" /> to <st data-num="04430" class="">King</st> <st data-num="05020" class="">Nebuchadnezzar</st>, “O <st data-num="04430" class="">king</st>, <st data-num="02418" class="">live</st> <st data-num="05957" class="">forever</st>!<n id="2" />

<st data-num="0607" class="">You</st> have <st data-num="07761" class="">issued</st> an <st data-num="02942" class="">edict</st>, O <st data-num="04430" class="">king</st>, <st data-num="01768" class="">that</st> <st data-num="03606 0606">everyone</st> must <st data-num="05308" class="">bow down</st> and <st data-num="05457" class="">pay homage</st> to the <st data-num="01722" class="">golden</st> <st data-num="06755" class="">statue</st> <st data-num="01768" class="">when</st> they <st data-num="08086" class="">hear</st> the <st data-num="07032" class="">sound</st> of the <st data-num="07162" class="">horn</st>, <st data-num="04953" class="">flute</st>, <st data-num="07030" class="">zither</st>, <st data-num="05443" class="">trigon</st>, <st data-num="06460" class="">harp</st>, <st data-num="05481" class="">pipes</st>, and <st data-num="03606" class="">all</st> <st data-num="02178" class="">kinds</st> of <st data-num="02170" class="">music</st>.

And <st data-num="04479 01768">whoever</st> does <st data-num="03809" class="">not</st> <st data-num="05308" class="">bow down</st> and <st data-num="05457" class="">pay homage</st> must be <st data-num="07412" class="">thrown</st> into the <st data-num="01459" class="">midst</st> of a <st data-num="0861" class="">furnace</st> of <st data-num="03345" class="">blazing</st> <st data-num="05135" class="">fire</st>.

But there are Jewish men whom you appointed over the administration of the province of Babylon—Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego—and these men have not shown proper respect to you, O king. They don’t serve your gods, and they don’t pay homage to the golden statue that you have erected.”
Then Nebuchadnezzar in a fit of rage demanded that they bring Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego before him. So they brought them before the king.

<st data-num="05020" class="">Nebuchadnezzar</st> <st data-num="06032 0560">said</st> to them, “Is it <st data-num="06656" class="">true</st>, <st data-num="07715" class="">Shadrach</st>, <st data-num="04336" class="">Meshach</st>, and <st data-num="05665" class="">Abednego</st>, that you <st data-num="03809 0383">don’t</st> <st data-num="06399" class="">serve</st> my <st data-num="0426" class="">gods</st> and that you <st data-num="03809" class="">don’t</st> <st data-num="05457" class="">pay homage</st> to the <st data-num="01722" class="">golden</st> <st data-num="06755" class="">statue</st> <st data-num="01768" class="">that</st> I <st data-num="06966" class="">erected</st>?

Now if you are ready, when you hear the sound of the horn, flute, zither, trigon, harp, pipes, and all kinds of music, you must bow down and pay homage to the statue that I had made. If you don’t pay homage to it, you will immediately be thrown into the midst of the furnace of blazing fire. Now, who is that god who can rescue you from my power?”

<st data-num="07715" class="">Shadrach</st>, <st data-num="04336" class="">Meshach</st>, and <st data-num="05665" class="">Abednego</st> <st data-num="06032 0560">replied</st> to <st data-num="04430" class="">King</st> <st data-num="05020" class="">Nebuchadnezzar</st>,<n id="1" /> “<st data-num="0586" class="">We</st> do <st data-num="03809" class="">not</st> <st data-num="02818" class="">need</st> to <st data-num="08421" class="">give</st> you a <st data-num="06600" class="">reply</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="05922" class="">concerning</st> <st data-num="01836" class="">this</st>.

<st data-num="02006" class="">If</st><n id="1" /> our <st data-num="0426" class="">God</st> <st data-num="01768" class="">whom</st> <st data-num="0586" class="">we</st> are <st data-num="06399" class="">serving</st> <st data-num="0383" class="">exists</st>,<n id="2" /> he <st data-num="03202" class="">is able</st> to <st data-num="07804" class="">rescue</st> us <st data-num="04481" class="">from</st> the <st data-num="0861" class="">furnace</st> of <st data-num="03345" class="">blazing</st> <st data-num="05135" class="">fire</st>, and he will <st data-num="07804" class="">rescue</st> us, O <st data-num="04430" class="">king</st>, <st data-num="04481" class="">from</st> your <st data-num="03028" class="">power</st> as well.
But if he does not, let it be known to you, O king, that we don’t serve your gods, and we will not pay homage to the golden statue that you have erected.”
Then Nebuchadnezzar was filled with rage, and his disposition changed toward Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego. He gave orders to heat the furnace seven times hotter than it was normally heated.

He <st data-num="0560" class="">ordered</st> <st data-num="01401 02429">strong</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="01400 01768">soldiers</st> in his <st data-num="02429" class="">army</st> to <st data-num="03729" class="">tie up</st> <st data-num="07715" class="">Shadrach</st>, <st data-num="04336" class="">Meshach</st>, and <st data-num="05665" class="">Abednego</st> and to <st data-num="07412" class="">throw</st> them into the <st data-num="0861" class="">furnace</st> of <st data-num="03345" class="">blazing</st> <st data-num="05135" class="">fire</st>.

<st data-num="0116" class="">So</st> <st data-num="0479" class="">those</st> <st data-num="01400" class="">men</st> were <st data-num="03729" class="">tied up</st> while still wearing their <st data-num="05622" class="">cloaks</st>, <st data-num="06361" class="">trousers</st>, <st data-num="03737" class="">turbans</st>, and other <st data-num="03831" class="">clothes</st>,<n id="1" /> and were <st data-num="07412" class="">thrown</st> <st data-num="01459" class="">into</st> the <st data-num="0861" class="">furnace</st><n id="2" /> of <st data-num="03345" class="">blazing</st> <st data-num="05135" class="">fire</st>.

<st data-num="03606 06903 01836">But</st> <st data-num="04481 01768">since</st> the <st data-num="04430" class="">king’s</st> <st data-num="04406" class="">command</st> was so <st data-num="02685" class="">urgent</st>, and the <st data-num="0861" class="">furnace</st> was so <st data-num="03493" class="">excessively</st> <st data-num="0228" class="">hot</st>, <st data-num="0479" class="">the</st> <st data-num="01400" class="">men</st> <st data-num="01768" class="">who</st> <st data-num="05267" class="">escorted</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="07715" class="">Shadrach</st>, <st data-num="04336" class="">Meshach</st>, and <st data-num="05665" class="">Abednego</st> were <st data-num="06992 01994">killed</st><n id="2" /> by the <st data-num="07631 01768">leaping</st> <st data-num="05135" class="">flames</st>.<n id="3" />
But those three men, Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego, fell into the furnace of blazing fire while still securely bound.
Then King Nebuchadnezzar was startled and quickly got up. He said to his ministers, “Wasn’t it three men that we tied up and threw into the fire?” They replied to the king, “For sure, O king.”

He <st data-num="06032 0560">answered</st>, “<st data-num="01888" class="">But</st> <st data-num="0576" class="">I</st> <st data-num="02370" class="">see</st> <st data-num="0703" class="">four</st> <st data-num="01400" class="">men</st>, <st data-num="08271" class="">untied</st> and <st data-num="01981" class="">walking around</st> in the <st data-num="01459" class="">midst</st> of the <st data-num="05135" class="">fire</st>! <st data-num="03809" class="">No</st> <st data-num="02257" class="">harm</st> has <st data-num="0383" class="">come</st> to them! And the <st data-num="07299" class="">appearance</st> <st data-num="01768" class="">of</st> the <st data-num="07244" class="">fourth</st> <st data-num="01821" class="">is like</st> that of <st data-num="01247" class="">a</st> <st data-num="0426" class="">god</st>!”<n id="1" />

Then Nebuchadnezzar approached the door of the furnace of blazing fire. He called out, “Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego, servants of the most high God, come out! Come here!”

Then Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego emerged from the fire.

Once the satraps, prefects, governors, and ministers of the king had gathered around, they saw that those men were physically unharmed by the fire. The hair of their heads was not singed, nor were their trousers damaged. Not even the smell of fire was to be found on them!

Nebuchadnezzar exclaimed, “Praised be the God of Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego, who has sent forth his angel and has rescued his servants who trusted in him, ignoring the edict of the king and giving up their bodies rather than serve or pay homage to any god other than their God!

I <st data-num="04481" class="">hereby</st> <st data-num="07761 02942">decree</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="01768" class="">that</st> <st data-num="03606" class="">any</st> <st data-num="05972" class="">people</st>, <st data-num="0524" class="">nation</st>, or <st data-num="03961" class="">language group</st> <st data-num="01768" class="">that</st> <st data-num="0560 07955 05922">blasphemes</st><n id="2" /> the <st data-num="0426" class="">God</st> <st data-num="01768" class="">of</st> <st data-num="07715" class="">Shadrach</st>, <st data-num="04336" class="">Meshach</st>, or <st data-num="05665" class="">Abednego</st> will be <st data-num="01917 05648">dismembered</st> and his <st data-num="01005" class="">home</st> <st data-num="07739" class="">reduced</st> to <st data-num="05122" class="">rubble</st>! <st data-num="03606 06903 01768">For</st> <st data-num="0383" class="">there exists</st> <st data-num="03809" class="">no</st> <st data-num="0321" class="">other</st> <st data-num="0426" class="">god</st> <st data-num="01768" class="">who</st> <st data-num="03202" class="">can</st> <st data-num="05338" class="">deliver</st> in <st data-num="01836" class="">this</st> way.”
Then Nebuchadnezzar promoted Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego in the province of Babylon.
